data.title: Monroe County election guide: five running for Ash Township trustee
data.meta_description: Republicans Michael Bosley, Christopher Ciersezwski, Charles Collert, Adam John Grabetz and Tina Richardson are running for Ash Township trustee.
data.text:
ASH TWP. — Voters in Monroe County have more than 30 contested races in the Aug. 6 primary election. The Monroe News sent questionnaires to the candidates in the contested races. Profiles of the candidates in contested primaries have been published over the last several days.

Below are the responses from the Ash Township trustee candidates. Two candidates will be elected in November. Seeking election are Republicans Michael Bosley, Christopher M. Ciersezwski, Charles J. Collert, Adam John Grabetz and Tina Richardson, all of Carleton. No Democrats filed for election. Candidate Grabetz could not be reached for comment.

The candidates' responses are printed as provided, though they may have been edited for clarity or truncated if the answers exceeded the given word limits.

In-person voting will take place from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. Tuesday, Aug. 6. Absentee ballots may be requested from township clerks.

Michael Bosley

Age: 62

Occupation: Director of test and technical services with a major automotive supplier

Spouse/kids: I have a beautiful wife and two grown daughters who are married, each with two girls of their own.

Government experience: None

Volunteer/community service experience: Currently active with church programs and activities

Why are you running for this position? I am interested in providing a balanced voice to help my community through its ongoing and future challenges.

What do you think is the main challenge facing Ash Township, and what should be done about it? Ash Township has a pleasant and country feel that is being discovered by many new and diverse folks. Growth brings ongoing and new challenges that must be balanced and understood to maintain the way of life that has been so appreciated and valued by our wonderful residences.

Why should people vote for you? With ongoing growth challenges, we must fairly balance growth with what has been so much valued by our current residences in having a rural and country way of life. I am offering to work for the community in a collaborative way to improve Ash Township for each resident, while keeping what has made our community such an attractive place to live and raise our families.

Christopher M. Ciersezwski

Age: 57

Occupation: Project manager

Spouse/kids: Debra/Jessica, Caitlin and Christopher Jr.

Government experience: Village of Carleton council

Volunteer/community service experience: Ash Township fireman for 29 years

Why are you running for this position? To help my community move forward and help improve the township

What do you think is the main challenge facing Ash Township, and what should be done about it? Try to fix bridges and helping the township residents to get city water and natural gas.

Why should people vote for you? I have been a resident of Ash township for 57 years and have been doing community service for 29 years and want to help the community in any way possible.

Charles Collert

Age: 54

Occupation: Self-employed

Spouse/kids: Shelley Collert, four children and three grandchildren

Government experience: Council member of Village of Carleton and member of Ash Township Planning Commission, Ash Park, Airport School Foundation and Village of Carleton Sewer Committee

Volunteer/community service experience: I give my time and resources to the school and community whenever call upon.

Why are you running for this position? To serve all residents and businesses.

What do you think is the main challenge facing Ash Township and what should be done about it? Preserving the resident district and trying to bring the right businesses into the township for a better tax base. It is hard to do with no sewer capacity. I would like to work with the Village of Carleton to help expand the sewer treatment plant. This would give the township more opportunities.

Why should people vote for you? I was born and raised in Ash Township. I own businesses in the township, so I have invested interest to make this township as great as it can be. I have experience from many years of being a council member in the Village of Carleton/Head of Sewer Committee as well as many more organizations. Also, I have been involved in many school projects.

Tina Richardson

Age: 57

Occupation: Deputy treasurer

Spouse/kids: Thomas Richardson and two sons, Nathan Richardson and Jared Richardson

Government experience: Deputy treasurer for 12 yrs. I am a Michigan Certified Public Treasurer (MICPT). I have taken the Michigan Certified Assessing Technician class (MCAT). Member of the Michigan Municipal Treasurers Association (MMTA) and the Michigan Township Association (MTA). I have experience working with Land Banks, Brownfields, Industrial Facility Tax (IFT’s), Downtown Development Authority (DDA) and Local Development Finance Authority (LDFA).

Why are you running for this position? I have been a resident with this community for 36 years. I have learned so much working in the government field the last 12 years. I feel I would be an asset to our community as a trustee.

What do you think is the main challenge facing Ash Township, and what should be done about it? Like most townships, I would say inflation. I would help monitor the cash flow and working capital during this time of economic uncertainty. I would ensure that the financial decisions being made are sustainable to meet our current needs without compromising future generations.

Why should people vote for you? The board of trustees serves the people of the township. Our job is to listen to the people and understand what they want for the place they live. I feel I would be an excellent choice with my experience, to do this for the residents of Ash Township.
